article.heading: 1. Purpose
article.paragraph: The parties agree to protect confidential information...

article.heading: 2. Obligations
article.paragraph: The Receiving Party agrees not to disclose any information...

article.heading: 3. Confidential Information
article.paragraph: The term "Confidential Information" means any information or material which is proprietary to the Owner, whether or not owned or developed by the Owner, which is not generally known other than by the Owner, and which the Recipient may obtain through any direct or indirect contact with the Owner.

article.heading: 4. Protection of Confidential Information
article.paragraph: The Recipient must protect this information by safeguarding it when in use, using it only for the business of the Company and disclosing it only when authorized to do so and to those who have a legitimate business need to know about it.

article.heading: 5. Scope of Confidentiality
article.paragraph: This duty of confidentiality applies whether the Recipient is on or off the Company's premises, and during and even after the end of the Recipientâ€™s engagement with the Company.

article.heading: 6. Electronic Communications
article.paragraph: This duty of confidentiality also applies to communications transmitted by the Company's electronic communications.

article.heading: 7. Mutual Consideration
article.paragraph: Now Therefore, for the mutual consideration of the terms and conditions set forth below, the receipt and the sufficiency of which are hereby mutually acknowledged, the parties hereby agree as follows to a binding contractual agreement:
